layer.name: Skill
layer.definition: Get measurably better at what matters.

questions.text: My ability to recognize early warning signs in my health is ...

answers.4: good — I've developed body awareness that catches things early
answers.5: sharp — I pick up signals quickly and respond before problems grow
answers.2: basic — I catch obvious signs but miss subtle ones
answers.3: developing — I notice some early warnings, miss others
answers.1: poor — I don't notice problems until they're serious

questions.text: My skill in communicating with healthcare providers is ...

answers.4: good — I can describe symptoms, ask questions, and advocate for myself
answers.5: strong — I'm an effective partner in my own healthcare
answers.2: basic — I can describe problems but don't ask good questions
answers.3: developing — I communicate some things well, fumble others
answers.1: poor — I don't know what to say or ask

questions.text: My understanding of how body, soul, and spirit interact in my own experience is ...

answers.4: good — I can usually trace how issues in one area affect others
answers.5: deep — I understand my own integration and address root causes
answers.2: basic — I know they're connected but can't trace it
answers.3: developing — I see some connections clearly, others not
answers.1: absent — I don't see how they connect

questions.text: My practical knowledge of preventive care is ...

answers.4: solid — I know what screenings and habits maintain health
answers.5: comprehensive — I understand prevention deeply and practice it
answers.2: basic — I know the big things but not details
answers.3: partial — I know some preventive practices, not others
answers.1: absent — I don't know what I should be doing

questions.text: My ability to make informed health decisions is ...

answers.4: good — I can evaluate options and choose wisely most of the time
answers.5: strong — I have the knowledge to make informed decisions confidently
answers.2: basic — I can make simple decisions but get lost in complexity
answers.3: developing — I make some good decisions, stumble on others
answers.1: poor — I just do what I'm told or nothing at all

remediation.advice: Health management is a skill. Learn to read your body's signals. Understand basic health literacy. Know what preventive care matters at your age. Develop the practical knowledge to be a good steward of your own health, not just a passive recipient of medical services.

scripture.text: And the God of peace will sanctify you completely, and may your whole spirit and soul and body be kept blameless.
